data.title: Arizona Christian University's Graduation and Dropout Rate
data.meta_description: Explore Arizona Christian University graduation, dropout and transfer rate. Stat breakdown by ethnicity/race.
data.text:
Graduation Rate

The following chart shows the graduation rate of Arizona Christian University students who enrolled in 2015 and after. The stat covers all undergraduates registered as full-time students to study a 4-year bachelor's degree program for the first time.

The breakdown shows the graduation rate by race/ethnicity of US students. All international students are represented under one group.

As of August 31, 2021, the average graduation rate of Arizona Christian University students is 35.8%. Female students graduated at a rate of 60.0%, whereas male students graduated at a rate of 25.9%.

Drop Out

Arizona Christian University has an overall drop-out rate of 53.3% as of August 31, 2021. The dropout rate of male students and female students is 64.7% and 25.7% respectively.

Below is a breakdown of the dropout rate of US students by race/ethnicity and international students.

Transferred Out

Students transfer out of Arizona Christian University at a rate of 10.8% yearly. As of 2015,female students' transfer rate was 14.3%, and male students' 9.4%

The breakdown shows the graduation rate by race/ethnicity of US students. All international students are represented under one group.
